      • getSystemLogin

        HashMap<String,Object> getSystemLogin(HashMap hm)
        The application checks whether the auto login is active. The user name(last login) is compared with system user name(account name on the machine). If the user names are equal, the client checks whether the operator has the auto login option. The result is successful, the operator is logged in automatically. The user mustn't log in every time. It has only one constraint. The client must start under the same system account(system login name on the machine). If the user tries to start the client on the machine with the different system account, the auto login doesn't work. The method allows to manipulate the user names and activates the auto login independent of the account name.
        Parameters:
        hm - empty, reserved for the future
        Returns:
        HashMap - the hashmap must have the key USERNAME for the possibility to manipulate the user names.

      • forwardServlet

        void forwardServlet(String operator,
                  boolean oper,
                  Question question,
                  HashMap hm)
        Is called in the function(interface: ICQuestion) while the question is forwarded: public boolean forward(Question question, String externalAddress, int subprojectId, HashMap ruleshm);
        Parameters:
        operator - current operator
        oper - true: the operator is in operator processing mode.
        question - the current question
        hm - not in use

      • matchNotFoundFilter

        HashMap<String,Object> matchNotFoundFilter(SingleMode sm,
                                         List<IViewFilter> filter,
                                         HashMap hm)
        The mails in the mail inbox are represented as SingleMode-objects. For the mail inbox processing: The mails are checked for the possibility to be visible in the mail inbox if the viewfilters are defined. The mails can be processed although they were filtered out by the logic(viewfilter definition). The result value must be "false". The method controls the visibility of SingleMode-objects in the mail inbox.
        Parameters:
        sm - the current entry(e.g. mail)
        filter - the active filters
        hm - the key "result"
        Returns:
        @return null or {key= RESULT ,value="true or false"}

      • matchFoundFilter

        HashMap<String,Object> matchFoundFilter(SingleMode sm,
                                      List<IViewFilter> filter,
                                      HashMap hm)
        The mails in the mail-inbox are represented as SingleMode-objects. For the mail-inbox processing: The mails are checked for the possibility to be visible in the mailinbox if the viewfilters are defined. The mails can't be processed although they were passed by the logic(viewfilter definition). The result value must be "false". The method controls the visibility of SingleMode-objects in the mailinbox.
        Parameters:
        sm - the current entry(e.g. mail)
        filter - the active filters
        hm - the key "result"
        Returns:
        null or {key=RESULT,value="true or false"}

      • getParameter

        HashMap getParameter(HashMap hm)
        The function gets the doc type favorites for the TagMatchPanel for the quick selection in the combobox.
        Parameters:
        hm - contains the project{key= PROJECT, value="ProjectId"}.
        Returns:
        hm {key="subprojectId", value="Vector(List)"}

      • setParameter

        HashMap setParameter(HashMap hm)
        The function stores the doc type favorites for the TagMatchPanel for the quick selection in the combobox.
        Parameters:
        hm - contains the project{key="PROJECT, value="ProjectId"}, the subproject{key="tpro", value="SubprojectId"}, the formtype{key="formtype", value="Formtype"}
        Returns:
        hm not in use

      • checkViewFilter

        HashMap checkViewFilter(JPanel viewFilterPanel,
                      IViewFilter vf,
                      boolean checked,
                      HashMap hm)
        The operator can make configurations in the ViewFilter panel to control the visibility of the mails in the mailinbox. For this purpose there are checkboxes, They can be activated or deactivated. After the selection of the viewfilter checkbox the method is called.
        Parameters:
        jp - the parent panel (the default value is null, use ViewFilterUserPanel#getInstance())
        vf - current viewfilter
        checked - the value choosed by the operator (selected or deselected)
        hm - not in use
        Returns:
        not in use

      • setViewFilterComponent

        @Deprecated
HashMap setViewFilterComponent(JPanel viewFilterPanel,
                                        HashMap hm)
        Deprecated. 
        Use {@link ViewFilterUserPanel#getInstance())
        Is called by the initialization of the view filter panel. The operator must have filter responsibilities to show the panel.
        Parameters:
        jp - current view filter panel (the default value is null, use ViewFilterUserPanel#getInstance())
        hm - not in use
        Returns:
        not in use

      • prePingSend

        boolean prePingSend(HashMap hm)
        The client sends to the application server every 3 minutes the information(ping) it's online. It's important to keep the current session open. The method is called before the ping is sent.
        Parameters:
        hm - not in use
        Returns:
        not in use

      • postPingSend

        void postPingSend(Hashtable ht)
        The client sent a ping to the server and becomes the answer back. is called after the ping function call.
        Parameters:
        ht - the return value of the ping function call. {key="Boolean",value="true"} - the session was updated(up to date) {key="-200",value="0"} - the ping was sent bevore the time interval achieved(e.g. bottleneck in the server, multiple ping calls from the same client) {key="questionId",value="operatorId"} - the mails reserved for the operator
